text: Gomal Pass () is a mountain pass on the Durand Line border between Afghanistan and South Waziristan in Pakistan's tribal areas. The name from it is from the Gomal River and is in the middle between the legendary Khyber Pass and the Bolan Pass. It connects the areas of Ghazni in Afghanistan with Tank and Dera Ismail Khan in Pakistan. Gomal Pass, for a long time, has been a trading route for nomadic Powindahs (nomads). ==Sources== Category:Mountain passes of Pakistan Category:Landforms of Afghanistan
title: Gomal Pass
